Header: ‘Reality-Based Self Defence’ Skills Demonstration Educates MLT Troops
Content: A group of Army personnel competent in Reality Based Self Defence (RBSD) martial art, attached to the Security Force Headquarters-East (SFHQ-E) conducted a demonstration for 3 Officers and 60 Other Ranks of the Security Force Headquarters - Mullaittivu (SFHQ-MLT) on 07 June 2018 in order to encourage them for the art. The event was held at the 23 Division Headquarters, Punani, in the presence of the General Officer Commanding 23 Division, Brigadier Chula Abenayaka. The Reality Based Self Defence (RBSD) course was carefully designed on the directions of the Commander, Security Forces - East (SF-E), Major General Santhusitha Pananwala with special focus on enhancing the capacity of men and women serving the Security Force Headquarters - East (SFHQ-E) to face any future security challenges. Reality Based Self Defence (RBSD) training module is pivotal for engagements and disengagements with aggressive crowds and individuals. These trained groups can be directed to collect information, intelligence-collecting, operations and strikes on the approval of relevant authorities. Accordingly, 23 Division has conducted 04 RBSD courses to date with the assistance of skilled and professional soldiers of the 1 Commando Regiment (CR).
